page.title: 01Dalton Holme and Thorpe
page.content: This area is dominaed in the west by Dalton Parkand its associated woodland but from any angle and indeed many miles away the spire of Dalton Holme Church rising to 210 feet can be seen. The church replaced pre=Norman buildings in 1860, though the deconcecrated shell of that at Holme remains. Further east across the flatter land with many woods lies Thorpe, once an important village but now mainly thought of as Lockington, its immediate neighbour. The former strategic position of the area on the edge of the River Hull marsh is marked with a Norman Motte and Bailey at Hall Garth alongside the Jacobean Manor; its purposeto control the main road North along the marsh side which is now mostly a footpath only within the block.
